TopicTitle: New info on tiangong 2, and other news...

Articles.Content:
Some new info has recently come to light about China's tiangong 2 space station/lab/module.

It is fully constructed and complete.

It will launch in late 2015.

It will launch on a long march 7.

It could therefore weigh within any of the lm-7's capabilities, 10-20 tonnes or with a yuanzheng-1 upperstage could even be heavier.

First mission to it will be in the first half of 2016.

3 manned missions to it.

My predictions: Looking likely to be a heavily modified t-1 backup although I'm still not sure why they couldn't just launch it on an existing rocket such as a lm-3b or 2f.

Oh and in other news China now has a Crawler/MLP.
10 tons is pushing it for CZ-7, 20 tons is well into CZ-5 territory.

10 tons is pushing it for CZ-7, 20 tons is well into CZ-5 territory.

Must have been a translation error.

The Chinese do everything one step at a time. This will be their 2nd station yet. After that, they start the construction of Tiangong 3 in 2016 up until 2020.

- - - Updated - - -
